content: 2nd chain from hook and across slip_stitch in next st f/o and weave in the tail ends head feathers attach color a yarn to top of head with a slip_stitch in the magic_ring feathers chain 7 work 3 half_double_crochet in 2nd chain from hook work a single_crochet in the next 5 chains slip_stitch to a hole next to the feather on top of the head make 2 feathers in color a 2 feathers in color b 2 feathers in color c *the feathers will be in a circle around each other* f/o and weave in the tail ends here is a video that might help https //www youtube com/watch v=xymqfw6apqs sweet oddity art 6 assembly beak 1 pin the beak onto the front of the face in between the eyes 2 sew the beak onto the face 3 embroider some highlights under the eyes 4 embroider some black lines above the eyes sweet oddity art 7 feet 1 pin the feet onto the front of the body 2 sew the feet onto the body wings 1 pin the wings onto the back of the body 2 sew the wings onto the body here is a video https //www youtube com/watch v=jtxuikdgc5o sweet oddity art 8 tail 1 pin the tail onto the back of the body 2 sew the tail onto the body here is a video that might help https //www youtube com/watch v=c_ttpbflpca you have your finished phoenix thank you for your purchase if you have any questions or concerns please email me at sweetoddityart@gmail com or etsy convo me i will get back to you asap please share your finished phoenix with me as often as you want i love seeing them sweet oddity art 9 helpful tips exact colors used 1 red premier parfait 2 orange premier parfait 3 yellow premier parfait you can use different eye sizes you might have to adjust the placements if you change the sizes you can use different hook sizes and weights of yarn it will just change the size of your phoenix and you might need to adjust eye placement how you stuff matters the type of stuffing you use how you stuff all this matters on how your phoenix turns out i prefer polyfil stuffing but you can use other types sweet oddity art 10
